titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Charles Drake Papers 1976-1997
titlestmt.author: James Feller

publicationstmt.publisher: Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-05-31.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS 2nd Edition ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

repository.corpname: Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries

did.abstract: This collection consists of publications by Charles H. Drake, information regarding a summer course taught by Drake, as well as papers related to the International Northwest Conference on Diseases in Nature Communicable to Man (INCDNCM).

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of papers of Washington State University faculty member and bacteriologist Charles H. Drake. It is divided into two sections with the first section consisting of papers directly related to his classes and publications. The second section consists of papers related to the International Northwest Conference on Diseases in Nature Communicable to Man (INCDNCM) and Drake's work with the organization, as well as a small number of group photographs of INCDNCM members.

bioghist.p: Charles H. Drake (1916-2002) was born in Waterloo, Iowa, and earned bachelor's, master's, and doctoral degrees from the University of Minnesota (1937, 1940, 1942). He was a professor in the Department of Bacteriology and Public Health at Washington State University for 36 years, retiring in 1981. He was a longtime member and officer of the International Northwest Conference on Diseases in Nature Communicable to Man (INCDNCM), serving as the President of the organization in 1957, Secretary in 1959, and giving the R.R. Parker Memorial Address at the organization's annual conference in 1976.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

processinfo.p: James Feller processed this collection in 2018.

acqinfo.p: Charles Drake donated this collection to the Washington State University Libraries in 1997 (MS.1997.29).

prefercite.p: [Item Description]; Charles Drake Papers, 1976-1997; Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections; Washington State University Libraries; Pullman, WA
